text: <@U0HP6TFNX> <@U1172PRDX> Will you 2 have the chance to review and give feedback (if necessary) on comps by tmrw. Would you like to keep the Wednesday meeting for that opportunity?
Possibly. Give me 20 minutes or so to review now? I'll see if they're far enough along to warrant a feedback call.
Cool
<@U0B9N0HF0> I'm trying to cross reference gidge's design with the most recent document where we talk about the scope of the testing. can you point me to the latest?
I'd still like to compare scope to Gidge's design docs, but I don't know that we need to meet tomorrow, based on how far along it is right now. <@U1172PRDX> what do you think?

Yea I'm in the same boat. Right now it seems to match up with our initial storyboards. But with Gidge still having sidebars with Patrick and others on additional features, I'm not sure how granular to get right now.

Yeah, scope is a bit of a tightrope here. Gidge has openly admitted that he feels it is necessary and is doing a bit of stakeholder placation with features like “word cloud”, etc. I’ve got an open request to him about building out a timeline for the rest of the prototype using our document because that scares me a bit (and apparently him who openly admitted to not being confident on the camera piece), but presently, please don’t focus your feedback on scope

Instead, please look to make sure that the comps accomplish the “jobs” we need done. Will these comps help illuminate gaps in admin workflow? Will they give us the  information we need to design Live Questions, etc.?

<@U0HP6TFNX> and I can focus on the admin side, but if we aren't focused on scope, then I feel the guest screens are more of a design exercise. For example, what are other ways to visual the bar graphs, etc.
<@U0B9N0HF0|rob> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/rob/F2X2F8Y1M/_bl_mobile__concept_validation_test_plan|[BL Mobile] Concept Validation Test Plan>
<@U1172PRDX> yes. Really just making sure the use cases we need to test are there
I'd love to get <@U02F9CXTL>'s eyes on the visuals

I see a bit of a risk with the current visuals being canon, but I feel if we don’t engage on them, then we’re leaving the door open for a redesign in the build phase. However, if we go back and forth on the look and feel, we lend further credibility to the current visuals being canon. Does that make sense?
In other words, if we keep them sloppy, we can change them. If we tighten them up, the risk that we can’t change them grows.
that makes sense. does it warrant jason starting to put together some thoughts on visuals now? or save that for later?

my thought being, since this is the only thing that patrick, etc are seeing, i don't want them to get too sold on it. i want others in the process to know that we're wanting to contribute to the look and feel.
maybe this is me overreacting to the half tone pattern :laughing:
Outside of the topic of how we get a voice in look and feel, it feels premature to me to give gidge feedback on what he has here, especially if scope is TBD.

There's a lot of our test plan not represented yet, but I assume he knows that, since we asked him to share his WIP so we could follow along.  He probably knows there's a lot still to do. But from a producer standpoint, do we want to meet to keep things moving along on his side?
I agree it all still feels a bit squishy

Ok thanks. Yes, very squishy.  My thought is, if we don’t have any feedback on current direction beyond scope/look and feel, then let’s not force anything and use this opportunity just to reinforce the message that “Since we’re building for quick and dirty functionality and not look and feel, everything looks fine to us” and then send along a list of jobs that we need completed that aren’t accomplished yet. I can put together than preliminary list for the both of you to review.
Does that sound good to you both?
works for me
:+1::skin-tone-3:
